item.title: Report E-2025060300
item.description:
Report E-2025060300

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR INDUSTRIAL SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading box noticed a leaking drum that was leaking from the bottom chime. The drum was removed from the box trailer and put into an overpack. In house cleanup methods were used to clean up the mess and everything was contained onsite and clean materials were managed properly. They think drum clips from moving the drums onto the trailer was the cause by where the drum was leaking.

item.title: Report X-2025061236
item.description:
Report X-2025061236

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The INDH spill office was presented a class 3 shipment that had an odor but while investigating the shipment they discovered a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal can that was dented on the top chime causing the release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025060241
item.description:
Report E-2025060241

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SAFETY-KLEEN SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver returned to facility from performing service it was noticed that the was a small amount of liquid under the drum and along the inside wall of the truck. They threw down some absorbent to collect the material the was released. There was less than a gallon released to the floor of the box truck. The drum was then placed into a salvage container and the absorbent was collected and placed in a container also to be disposed of.

item.title: Report X-2025060797
item.description:
Report X-2025060797

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The shipment contained one metal can that was dented on the sides, and this caused the lid to open spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: While in transit, the driver noticed material coming out of his trailer. He immediately pulled over and isolated the released material. A contractor was called to assist. The drum was overpacked. Approximately 10 gallons were released, most of which was contained in the trailer. No storm drains, waterways, or ground beyond the concrete shoulder were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2025050485
item.description:
Report E-2025050485

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of phosphoric acid fell over in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed neutralizing agent to the release, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025052280
item.description:
Report X-2025052280

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION AND OPENED THE BOX TO IDENTIFY THE SUBSTANCE AND SWEEP UP THE LOOSE SUBSTANCE FROM THE LOADING CHUTE. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX THAT THERE WAS ANY SORT OF HAZARDOUS OR LIMITED QUANTITY ITEM IN THE BOX. WHEN THE BOX WAS OPENED, THE LID OF THE BUCKET WAS COMPLETELY LOOSE. UPON REMOVING THE BUCKET FROM THE BOX, RESPONDER NOTED BOTH THE OXIDIZER AND ENVIRONMENTAL DIAMOND HAZARD STICKERS ON THE BUCKET, AS WELL AS THE UN NUMBER (UN 2880). BOX AND BUCKET WERE BROUGHT BACK TO THE CAGE AND THE HAZMAT HELP DESK CALLED TO REPORT A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED HAZMAT

  • Description: At 0236 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCW. It was reported that approximately 1 quart of SikaGard 250 KNS was released from a 5-gallon metal can due to improper dunnage by terminal LSL. The release impacted trailer # 5158225. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and a NIOSH-certified (or equivalent) organic vapour/particulate respirator is required for cleanup and contractor was advised. The caller refused assistance stating that they have the PPE necessary for cleanup. 238052-1 10-gallon DM contains a 5-gallon metal can of SikaGard 250 KNS and oil dri

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal cans due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the cans being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel containerized impacted cardboard into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. They also containerized the damaged cans into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. item.title: Report E-2025050528
item.description:
Report E-2025050528

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: t 1048 ET, XPO-XCW notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 5 cups of phycomycin scp released from a plastic bag due to no dunnage. The release impacted inside trailer#319-1512 and the concrete dock. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-cups of UN3378 Phycomycin SCP product was released to a 6x2 and 3x1 area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading (dunnage). The contractors swept up the spilled material and restacked the pallet and placed the impacted bag into (1) 55-gallon poly tote. The swept up product was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050571
item.description:
Report E-2025050571

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT-OHIO EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the pail was discovered leaking inside of the trailer. Investigation revealed that the pail was leaking due to a nail puncture in the bottom of the pail. The puncture was caused by a protruding nail head in the skid. The pail was immediately placed into an overpack and the released material was neutralized and containerized for disposal. Due to the hazard of material the packaging specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

  • Description: While inspecting the shipment, prior to departure, the driver noticed a drum leaking from the bottom chime. As the remaining drums were inspected 11 more were found to be leaking, also from the bottom chime. All leaking drums were placed into overpacks and the released material was cleaned up.
